results.title: Nicolas Cage Is in on the Nicolas Cage Jokes
results.abstract: In his new movie, “The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent,” the actor plays “himself” in all his meme-ified glory.
des_facet: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent (Movie)

results.title: Father Doesn’t Know Best at New Directors/New Films
results.abstract: Returning to an in-person event, this year’s adventurous festival is filled with discoveries that use families to explore contemporary life.

results.title: Alexander Skarsgard’s Viking Dream
results.abstract: Stories from his grandfather inspired what would eventually become “The Northman.” But it took years of development and then seven months in the mud to complete.

multimedia.caption: Skarsgard said of “The Northman” that it was “the greatest experience of my career but, God, it was intense.”

results.abstract: In a heist film-inspired DreamWorks comedy, the Big Bad Wolf goes good, begrudgingly.

results.title: ‘Rust’ Producers Get Maximum Fine in Cinematographer’s Death
results.abstract: The production company, which included the actor Alec Baldwin, was fined $136,000 and was criticized for showing indifference to “recognized hazards.”

multimedia.caption: Workplace safety regulators for the state of New Mexico cited the producers of the film “Rust” on Wednesday for failures on the set that they said contributed to the death of a cinematographer who was fatally shot.

Workplace safety regulators for the state of New Mexico cited the producers of the film “Rust” on Wednesday for failures on the set that they said contributed to the death of a cinematographer who was fatally shot.

results.title: Why Those Moments of Care for Liza Minnelli and Joni Mitchell Felt Different
results.abstract: Awards shows are a natural setting for honoring aging legends. It’s reassuring when they don’t try to hide the frailty that aging can bring.

results.title: Johnny Depp, Accused of Spousal Abuse, Says Ex-Wife Was the Aggressor
results.abstract: The actor testified in a defamation case that he filed against his ex-wife, Amber Heard, who has said he often struck her during their relationship.

results.title: Michel Bouquet, Award-Winning French Actor, Dies at 96
results.abstract: One of his country’s great theater performers, he went on to appear in more than 100 films playing ordinary men whose surface blandness masked complex lives.

multimedia.caption: Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.
Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.

results.title: Let Him Entertain You: Billy Crystal Returns to Broadway
results.abstract: The comedian is starring in “Mr. Saturday Night,” a musical version of his 1992 movie about an aging performer who won’t accept that his time in the spotlight is up.

multimedia.caption: “The worst nightmare is, do you wake up one day and you’re not funny anymore?” Billy Crystal, 74, said of the anxiety that comes with being an aging comedian. “Do you wake up and you’re not relevant?”
multimedia.copyright: Philip Montgomery for The New York Times
